intro: Euxolus, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Euxolus in the family Polygonaceae, which includes other species with similar morphological traits. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are typically small, narrow, and covered in a fine layer of hairs, aiding in water conservation. Euxolus thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation.
